page.title: 03SECTION 2 + SECTION 3
page.content:
Section 2
LAND COVER ll - Intensively Managed grassland l2 - Rough Grazing l4 - Woodland dominantly deciduous trees
Section 3 - Foot of Ullswater This area contains l/3 water, l/3 woodland and l/3 farm land with commercial undertakings.
LOCAL HISTORY - Ullswater, the Lake is derived from the Norwegian personal name Ulfr, and Dunmallet, (Slide C), the woodland, from the gaelic Dunmallaght, meaning 'hill of weeping' or 'hill of curses'. Unexcavated iron age fort at summit. Eamont, the river, is an anglican word "Eagamot" for a junction of streams.
